meanings.definition: Something that discourages or deters someone from taking a particular action.
meanings.sent1: High prices can act as disincentives for people to buy luxury items.
meanings.sent2: The lack of job security serves as a disincentive for employees to stay in a company.
meanings.sent3: The rainy weather was a disincentive for the picnic we had planned.
meanings.sent4: The long commute to work acted as a disincentive for moving to the new neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The strict dress code at the office was a strong disincentive for casual Fridays.

meanings.definition: Factors that reduce the motivation or desire to do something.
meanings.sent1: Lack of recognition can be one of the biggest disincentives for employees.
meanings.sent2: Constant criticism can create disincentives for students to participate in class.
meanings.sent3: The endless paperwork was a disincentive for the teacher to grade assignments.
meanings.sent4: The fear of failure can act as a powerful disincentive for taking risks.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules imposed by the coach were strong disincentives for the team to break them.
